# Timeline of Healthcare Privacy Protections

* 1996: Healthcare Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) signed into law
* 1999: HIPAA Privacy Rule put out for public comment; first issued in 2002
  * Establishes standards to secure "protected health information"
  * Limits uses and disclosures of health information
  * Establishes individual rights over protected health information

# Data Privacy Online

* 2012 study at Carnegie Mellon showed that:
  * The median privacy policy is 2,518 words long
  * The average user takes 10 minutes to read a privacy policy
  * The average user encounters 1,462 policies a year
  * It would take 76 8-hour work days to read all user agreements in a year
  * ...i.e. over 3 months per year of work time

# Thinking Ethically

* Rights Approach: Prioritizing individual rights
* Justice Approach: Distributing benefits and risks fairly
* Utilitarian Approach: Weighing good vs. evil
* Common Good Approach: Prioritizing policies and structres that benefit all community members
* Virtue Approach: Pursuing moral ideals 

> Thinking Ethically: A Framework for Moral Decision Making. Velasquez, M., C. Andre, T. Shanks, and M. J. Meyer. Center for Applied Ethics, Santa Clara University.
